ccre.igneous

Interface IgneousLauncher


  • public interface IgneousLauncher
    This is a launcher for an Igneous application. The reason for this is so that the main program can be ran without a robot. Documentation for all the methods here can be found in IgneousCore, where they are invoked.
    Author:
    skeggsc

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int JAGUAR
      The ID for a Jaguar speed controller.
      static int TALON
      The ID for a Talon speed controller.
      static int VICTOR
      The ID for a Victor speed controller.

    • Method Detail

      • getJoystick

        IJoystick getJoystick(int id)
        Accesses a Joystick from the Driver Station.
        Parameters:
        id - the Joystick number (1-4)
        Returns:
        the associated joystick on the driver station.

      • getKinectJoystick

        IJoystick getKinectJoystick(boolean isRightArm)
        Get an IJoystick for the specified Kinect virtual joystick.
        Parameters:
        isRightArm - If the right arm joystick should be used instead of the left. (6 instead of 5 if you're used to the old system.)
        Returns:
        the IJoystick.

      • makeMotor

        FloatOutput makeMotor(int id,
                    int type)
        Create a reference to a speed controller.
        Parameters:
        id - the motor port ID, from 1 to 10, inclusive.
        type - the motor type: JAGUAR, VICTOR, or TALON.
        Returns:
        the output that will output to the specified motor.
        See Also:
        JAGUAR, VICTOR, TALON

        Create a reference to a solenoid on the specified port.
        Parameters:
        id - the port of the solenoid.
        Returns:
        the output that will control the solenoid.

      • makeAnalogInput

        FloatInputPoll makeAnalogInput(int id,
                             int averageBits)
        Create a reference to an analog input on the specified port with the specified number of average bits.
        Parameters:
        id - the port number.
        averageBits - the number of averaging bits.
        Returns:
        the analog input, reporting in voltage.

      • makeAnalogInput_ValuedBased

        FloatInputPoll makeAnalogInput_ValuedBased(int id,
                                         int averageBits)
        Create a reference to an analog input's raw value on the specified port with the specified number of average bits.
        Parameters:
        id - the port number.
        averageBits - the number of averaging bits.
        Returns:
        the analog input, reporting in uncalibrated units.

        Returns:

      • makeServo

        FloatOutput makeServo(int id,
                    float minInput,
                    float maxInput)
        Create a reference to a servo controller for the specified port and minimum and maximum values.
        Parameters:
        id - the port number.
        minInput - the value on the output that should correspond to the servo's minimum position.
        maxInput - the value on the output that should correspond to the servo's maximum position.
        Returns:
        the FloatOutput that controls the servo.

                int lineid)
        Send the specified string to the specified line of the driver station.
        Parameters:
        value - The string to display.
        lineid - The line number (1-6).

      • useCustomCompressor

        void useCustomCompressor(BooleanInputPoll shouldDisable,
                       int compressorRelayChannel)
        Activate the compressor on the given pressure switch input and compressor relay channel.
        Parameters:
        shouldDisable - should the compressor be turned off.
        compressorRelayChannel - the channel of the compressor's relay.

      • makeEncoder

        FloatInputPoll makeEncoder(int aChannel,
                         int bChannel,
                         boolean reverse,
                         EventInput resetWhen)
        Create a reference to an Encoder on the specified ports with the specified number of average bits.
        Parameters:
        aChannel - The alpha-channel for the encoder.
        bChannel - The beta-channel for the encoder.
        reverse - Should the result of the encoder be negated?
        resetWhen - If provided, the Encoder's value will be reset when this event is produced.
        Returns:
        the Encoder, reporting encoder ticks.

      • makeRelayForwardOutput

        BooleanOutput makeRelayForwardOutput(int channel)
        Create a reference to the Forward side of the relay on the specified channel - this side can be turned on and off.
        Parameters:
        channel - The relay channel.
        Returns:
        the output that will modify the forward side of the channel.

      • makeRelayReverseOutput

        BooleanOutput makeRelayReverseOutput(int channel)
        Create a reference to the Reverse side of the relay on the specified channel - this side can be turned on and off.
        Parameters:
        channel - The relay channel.
        Returns:
        the output that will modify the reverse side of the channel.

      • makeGyro

        FloatInputPoll makeGyro(int port,
                      double sensitivity,
                      EventInput evt)
        Create a reference to a Gyro on the specified port with the specified sensitivity. This will allow reading the current rotation of the Gyro. This also takes an EventInput, and when this is fired, the Gyro will be reset. Increased sensitivity means a smaller output for the same turn.
        Parameters:
        port - The Gyro port number.
        sensitivity - The sensitivity of the Gyro. This is the number of volts/degree/second sensitivity of the gyro and is used in calculations to allow the code to work with multiple gyros. 0.007 is a good default value.
        evt - When to reset the Gyro.
        Returns:
        The reference to the Gyro's current value.

      • makeAccelerometerAxis

        FloatInputPoll makeAccelerometerAxis(int port,
                                   double sensitivity,
                                   double zeropoint)
        Create a reference to a Accelerometer Axis on the specified port, with the specified sensitivity and voltage zero point.
        Parameters:
        port - The port number to attach to.
        sensitivity - The sensitivity of the accelerometer. This varies per model.
        zeropoint - The voltage that corresponds to 0 G. This also varies by model.
        Returns:
        The reference to the axis on the Accelerometer.

      • getBatteryVoltage

        FloatInputPoll getBatteryVoltage()
        Get a reference to the analog input that reads the current battery voltage, scaled to represent the real battery voltage.
        Returns:
        The current battery voltage.

      • getGlobalPeriodic

        EventInput getGlobalPeriodic()
        Returns:
        an event that is produced during every mode if the driver station is attached.

        Returns:

      • getDuringDisabled

        Returns:
        an event that is produced while the robot is disabled.

      • usePCMCompressor

        BooleanOutput usePCMCompressor()
        Returns:
        an output that enables and disabled the PCM compressor's closed-loop control.

      • getPCMPressureSwitch

        BooleanInputPoll getPCMPressureSwitch()
        Returns:
        the status of the PCM pressure switch.

      • getPCMCompressorRunning

        BooleanInputPoll getPCMCompressorRunning()
        Returns:
        the status of the PCM compressor enable.

      • getPCMCompressorCurrent

        FloatInputPoll getPCMCompressorCurrent()
        Returns:
        the current draw of the PCM compressor.
